# Cambridge IGCSE™  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 170, 183, 187]]<|/det|>
## PHYSICS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 194, 332, 210]]<|/det|>
Paper 1 Multiple Choice (Core)  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 170, 905, 187]]<|/det|>
0625/13  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[784, 194, 905, 210]]<|/det|>
May/June 2020  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[814, 217, 905, 232]]<|/det|>
45 minutes  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 247, 507, 264]]<|/det|>
You must answer on the multiple choice answer sheet.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 277, 437, 293]]<|/det|>
You will need: Multiple choice answer sheet  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[215, 291, 539, 320]]<|/det|>
Soft clean eraser Soft pencil (type B or HB is recommended)  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 337, 228, 352]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 352, 907, 384]]<|/det|>
There are forty questions on this paper. Answer all questions.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 365, 907, 400]]<|/det|>
For each question there are four possible answers \(\mathbf{A}\) , \(\mathbf{B}\) , \(\mathbf{C}\) and \(\mathbf{D}\) . Choose the one you consider correct and record your choice in soft pencil on the multiple choice answer sheet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 397, 579, 415]]<|/det|>
Follow the instructions on the multiple choice answer sheet.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 413, 277, 429]]<|/det|>
Write in soft pencil.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 428, 868, 460]]<|/det|>
Write your name, centre number and candidate number on the multiple choice answer sheet in the spaces provided unless this has been done for you.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 458, 331, 475]]<|/det|>
Do not use correction fluid.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 475, 366, 491]]<|/det|>
Do not write on any bar codes.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 490, 329, 506]]<|/det|>
You may use a calculator.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 504, 672, 522]]<|/det|>
Take the weight of \(1.0\mathrm{kg}\) to be \(10\mathrm{N}\) (acceleration of free fall \(= 10\mathrm{m / s}^2\) ).

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 549, 220, 564]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 565, 391, 581]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 580, 806, 597]]<|/det|>
Each correct answer will score one mark. A mark will not be deducted for a wrong answer.  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[96, 596, 571, 613]]<|/det|>

done against
gravity by lift		useful power

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 339, 106, 357]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 339, 635, 357]]<|/det|> The diagram shows an early model of the structure of an atom. <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[322, 365, 675, 490]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 501, 672, 520]]<|/det|> This early model is different from the atomic model accepted today. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 532, 816, 549]]<|/det|> Which statement about the early model is **not** included in the model accepted today? <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 560, 134, 578]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 560, 598, 578]]<|/det|> The atom is mainly filled with a ball of positive charge. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 587, 134, 604]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 587, 467, 604]]<|/det|> The electrons are negatively charged. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 613, 134, 631]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 613, 492, 631]]<|/det|> There are positive and negative charges. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 640, 134, 657]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 640, 497, 657]]<|/det|> There are small particles called electrons.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 431, 536, 450]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[151, 458, 398, 476]]<|/det|>
